Title: How to Watch Horror Movies Without Being Too Scared
Summary: How to get into the season, even if you’re squeamish.

Title: We Want to Know Your Questions About Theater, Film, Music and Culture
Summary: Your culture and entertainment questions answered by New York Times journalists and experts.

Title: Lauren Mayberry’s Lush Pop Ecstasy, and 13 More New Songs
Summary: Hear tracks by Bartees Strange, the Smile, Ela Minus and others.

Summary: Out this week, a period possession movie starring Sarah Paulson, a chef-driven supernatural thriller starring Ariana DeBose and more.

Title: ‘Food and Country’ Offers a Close Look at How America Feeds Itself
Summary: “Food and Country” argues that our food production systems don’t work and offers potential solutions.

Title: When John Amos Had Enough of the ‘Good Times’
Summary: The actor, whose death was announced this week, made it known he didn’t like the direction the hit show was going. His character was then killed off.

Title: Los Angeles District Attorney Says He Is Reviewing Menendez Brothers Case
Summary: Interest in the Menendez brothers has intensified after the release of a new Netflix drama about the case. A separate documentary is forthcoming.

Title: Brooklyn Museum at 200 Celebrates Beauty and Art’s Hidden History
Summary: A new American wing draws on feminist and racially and ethnically diverse thinking to spotlight 400 exceptional works in its collection.

Title: Richard Mayhew, Painter of Abstract Landscapes, Dies at 100

Title: 10 Unforgettable Kris Kristofferson Covers
Summary: Many of his songs are better known by other singers’ interpretations, like Janis Joplin’s “Me and Bobby McGee,” Johnny Cash’s “Sunday Morning Coming Down” and more.

Title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
Summary: This month’s picks include cool fighter pilots, a feminist queen and urban turf wars.

Title: Saoirse Ronan Has Lived, and Acted, Through a Lot
Summary: At 30, the Irish actress has already spent two decades in front of the camera, collecting many awards. Her two latest projects are also generating Oscars buzz.

Summary: Whether you’re a casual moviegoer or an avid buff, our reviewers think these films are worth knowing about.

Title: Cady Noland and the Art of Control
Summary: Cady Noland, who became the darling of the art world, has tested the limits.

Title: Late Night Heaps Scorn on Trump’s Latest Defense
Summary: Jimmy Kimmel said Donald Trump was “partially right” in denying interference in the 2020 election: “He tried to rig the election and failed to rig the election.’

Title: Time-Traveling Film ‘Safety Not Guaranteed’ Hits Some Bumps Onstage
Summary: Adapted from the offbeat 2012 movie, this new musical about loneliness and the longing for do-overs is promising but still needs to find its shape.

Title: Garth Brooks Is Accused of Rape and Sexual Assault in Lawsuit
Summary: A woman who worked as a hair and makeup stylist for the country superstar says he subjected her to repeated advances. Mr. Brooks said it is “behavior I am incapable of.”

Title: 8 New Books We Recommend This Week
Summary: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.

Title: ‘Where’s Wanda?’ Is a Charming German Dramedy
Summary: A small-town European murder mystery but more stylish than most — and less miserable.

Title: ‘Rust’ Western Will Premiere in Europe 3 Years After Fatal Shooting
Summary: After the Alec Baldwin movie turned into the scene of a tragedy with the death of its cinematographer, the film will debut next month at a festival that celebrates cinematography.

Title: ‘The Rings of Power’ Season 2 Finale Recap: Highs and Lows
Summary: The second season ended in a whirlwind of fire and steel, darkness and light, capping an eight-episode run with many ups and downs.

Title: Lawyers for a Sean Combs Accuser Ask to Withdraw From Her Case
Summary: A dispute between Adria English, who has accused Mr. Combs of sexual misconduct, and her lawyers is the latest twist in the civil litigation the music mogul is facing.

Title: ‘Joker: Folie à Deux’ Review: Make ’Em Laugh (and Yawn)
Summary: Todd Phillips’s “Joker” sequel stars Joaquin Phoenix and Lady Gaga who sing and dance like crazy kids, but the movie is seriously un-fun.

Title: From One Nonagenarian Artist to Another, a Tip of the Hat
Summary: Alex Katz admired a Mark di Suvero sculpture and gave it to the Brooklyn Museum. It now has pride of place in the museum’s 200th anniversary celebration.

Title: What to See in N.Y.C. Galleries in October
Summary: This week in Newly Reviewed, Martha Schwendener covers Dennis Kardon’s wonderfully strange paintings, Klara Liden’s green vistas and Sheryl Sutton’s mesmerizing movements.

Title: What James Ensor Knew About the Masks We Wear
Summary: Seventy-five years after the artist’s death, the grotesque masquerades he painted aren’t so far from the manipulated faces of the present day.

Title: She Was Diagnosed With Brain Cancer, Then Wrote a Rom-Com About It
Summary: Sophie Kinsella, the author of “Confessions of a Shopaholic,” packs love, laughter and a harrowing real-life health ordeal into a 133-page novella.

Title: ‘Blink’ Review: The Last Things They May See
Summary: In this travel documentary, two parents take their children on a spectacular world tour before a rare genetic condition may cause blindness.

Title: ‘Daaaaaalí!’ Review: Keeping It Surreal
Summary: The French absurdist director Quentin Dupieux did not make a biopic of Salvador Dalí — he adopted the Surrealist painter’s approach to deliver a particularly loopy tale.

Title: Tory Burch Shares Her Makeup and Skin-Care Essentials
Summary: Plus: a new hotel on the Athens Riviera, salvaged jewelry and more recommendations from T Magazine.

Title: ‘Saturday Night Live’: 11 Defining Political Sketches
Summary: Since the 1970s, the late-night institution has offered up definitive impersonations of American presidents and other politicians. Here are its most memorable political sketches.

Summary: Earnest love stories by Rainbow Rowell, TJ Klune and Talia Hibbert will tug at your heartstrings while grappling with real, often dark, issues.

Title: ‘White Bird’ Review: After ‘Wonder,’ a Bully Moves On
Summary: A boy starts a new school and gets a history lesson from his grandmother, played by Helen Mirren.

Title: ‘It’s What’s Inside’ Review: I Gotta Be You

Title: ‘The Outrun’ Review: From Rock Bottom to Recovery
Summary: Saoirse Ronan gives another stunning performance in a story about an alcoholic in search of healing.

Title: ‘Intercepted’ Review: The Awful Intimacy of the War in Ukraine

Title: At Frieze London, Artists Make Connections Through Clay

Title: In London, a Showcase of Art From the South Asian Diaspora
Summary: The collector and curator Rajan Bijlani will showcase the works of six artists and his sizable design collection in “Syncretic Voices,” a Frieze Week exhibition.

Title: Artist Lee Bul Ruffles the Met’s Staid Niches
Summary: The artist for the fifth Facade Commission created Cubist sculptures that look forward and backward. The question is what more the Met can do going forward.

Title: In Tokyo, a Small Gallery Focuses on Conceptual Art
Summary: Striving to be unique, it is bringing attention to artists from around the world whose works have rarely been seen in Japan.

Title: As Taylor Swift and Others Revive Cassettes, Fans Look for Tape Decks
Summary: Musicians and fans have developed a new taste for an old format, but manufacturers largely stopped making players. Listeners are finding creative (and vintage) solutions.

Summary: The British musician, artist and writer will do a live painting session at Frieze London. These days he’s focusing on landscapes and his family.

Title: Late Night Sums Up a Strangely Chill VP Debate
Summary: Jimmy Fallon said viewers “were expecting a horror movie, but instead, they got a Hallmark movie.”

Title: Ports Rush to Reopen After Dockworker Strike Is Suspended
Summary: Days after tens of thousands of longshoreman along the East and Gulf Coasts walked out, their union and their bosses reached a tentative agreement on wages.

Title: Port Strike’s End Is an Economic Relief to Savannah, Ga.

Title: Jobs Report Gives Kamala Harris Another Boost
Summary: Recent reports have shown inflation slowing and the economy growing at a robust clip. The Fed has also cut interest rates, bringing mortgage rates down.

Title: A Strong Jobs Report Suggests the Economy Is More Resilient Than We Thought
Summary: After months of wobbling, a fresh jobs report showed that hiring and wage growth are strong, aligning with other robust economic data.

Summary: U.S. employers added 254,000 jobs in September, a sign that economic growth remained solid. The unemployment rate fell to 4.1 percent.

Title: The Pandemic Small Business Boom Is Still Helping to Fuel the Economy
Summary: A record surge in new businesses has helped drive job growth, and could have longer-term benefits.

Summary: The International Longshoremen’s Association received a new wage offer and will halt its walkout at East and Gulf Coast ports, which began Tuesday.

Summary: War in the Middle East, a strike by port workers and a devastating hurricane injected uncertainty into the U.S. economy.

Summary: Harold J. Daggett is seeking big raises for longshoremen on the East and Gulf Coasts who have fallen behind workers on the West Coast.

Title: Trump and Harris Want to Revive Manufacturing, but How Much Could They Actually Do?

Title: The Whiskey Industry Is Bracing for a Trade War if Trump Wins. It’s Not Alone.
Summary: Business owners and foreign governments are preparing for high tariffs and trade disruptions, depending on the outcome of the election.
